timeline.tekst: I was born in Aalst, Belgium. Raised in Affligem.
I went to kindergarten and primary school in De Klimming, Affligem
I started playing basketbal at BC Asse-Ternat
I started my secondary education at the Vrij Technisch Instituut Aalst, where I pursued studies in Industrial Sciences.
I took the initiative to create the Facebook page for WSC Dr. Tistaertvrienden VZW and gradually became increasingly involved in the organization of cycling races and more.
I began managing the content of the website of WSC Dr. Tistaertvrienden VZW.
The Dr. Tistaertvrienden organization is organizing the 100th edition of the Grand Prix Affligem for elite riders without a contract and promising young talents (beloften).
I started my studies in Industrial Engineering at Ghent University.
I discontinued my studies in Industrial Engineering and transitioned to Applied Computer Science.
Despite the challenges posed by the COVID-19 pandemic, the Dr. Tistaertvrienden organization successfully organized the Belgian Championship for junior cyclists (U17, nieuwelingen).

For the first time, I am taking on the role of overall responsibility for the Affligem Classic. The 32nd edition marks the first time that I am independently organizing the event, with the invaluable support of the Dr. Tistaertvrienden organization.
Together with two other members, I am organizing a women's race for the first time specifically catering to elite female cyclists.
